item.title: Dan add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "A writer is a reader moved to emulation." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Dan add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Out of the quarrel with others we make rhetoric; out of the quarrel with ourselves we make poetry." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Dan add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "I am still of [the] opinion that only two topics can be of the least interest to a serious and studious mood--sex and the dead." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Dan add a quote by Robert Henri
item.description: "Art is, after all, only a trace â€“ like a footprint which shows that one has walked bravely and in great happiness." -- Robert Henri

item.title: Dan add a quote by Robert Henri
item.description: "Do whatever you do intensely." -- Robert Henri

item.title: Dan add a quote by Robert Henri
item.description: "Don't worry about your originality. You couldn't get rid of it even if you wanted to. It will stick with you and show up for better or worse in spite of all you or anyone else can do." -- Robert Henri

item.title: Dan add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?" -- John Keats

item.title: Dan add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Whatever the imagination seizes as Beauty must be truth -whether it existed before or not" -- John Keats

item.title: Dan add a quote by William Carlos Williams
item.description: "It is difficult to get the news from poems, yet men die miserably every day for lack of what is found there." -- William Carlos Williams

item.title: Dan add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the Heart's affections and the truth of the Imagination." -- John Keats

item.title: Dan add a quote by Jack Gilbert
item.description: "Everyone forgets Icarus also flew. " -- Jack Gilbert
